result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole E. Ferron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 2nd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12:13 pm case called. Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached-argued sentence.   Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Ulrich. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 3 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. To begin by October 1, 2016. No credit for time served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 11:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich in court, appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S Requested and Scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on July 19, 2016 at 10:20 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has met with SPD and does qualify. Atty Szilagyi requesting a STC.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 10:20 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicole E. Ferron
Current: 146 Jocelyn St, Apt 7, Oshkosh, WI 54904 United States  (Effective: 06-20-2016)
Prior: W6884 State Road 21, Wautoma, WI 54982
Status conference on June 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.     Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 3:02 PM: Defendant Nicole E. Ferron in court, appearing pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - currently not employed.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.  NGP entered by Court.  DA argues for $500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection by Defendant.   In person STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
